LGTM, thanks for the patch @gchen :-)

To deploy eagle, we provide helper shell eagle-docker, firstly, download source code:

```
git clone https://github.com/apache/incubator-eagle.git
```

then deploy eagle without building imges:(it will download image from docker hub)

```
incubator-eagle/eagle-docker --node 3 deploy
```

or deploy eagle with rebuilding eagle images from source code:

```
incubator-eagle/eagle-docker --node 3 boot
```

Finally, nothing should be done anymore from you, eagle will be deployed automatically.

To get eagle-docker images only, download from docker hub:

```
docker pull apacheeagle/sandbox
```

1) The change here https://github.com/apache/incubator-eagle/blob/master/eagle-core/eagle-data-process/eagle-stream-process-api/src/main/java/org/apache/eagle/dataproc/impl/storm/kafka/KafkaSourcedSpoutScheme.java#L63 breaks the previous features
2) Keep default implementation for kafka provider instead of forcing developer to declare schema

Cc: "Zhang, Edward (GDI Hadoop)" <yonzhang@ebay.com<mailto:yonzhang@ebay.com>>
Subject: Re: [incubator-eagle] EAGLE-99 policy distribution reporter (#36)

Edward, the apache ci was running on a problematic slave machine and gave the wrong build status, which made the none-valued judgement on your pr. Do you need to close and reopen this pr to re-fresh the status?

—
Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/apache/incubator-eagle/pull/36#issuecomment-167023335.

This is tricky. I also tested my pr for testing, and the result is, if the CI job enables pr trigger, any failure can cause your pr to be marked as Fail; and if I disable the trigger, your pr cannot be refreshed.
In this situation, while I'm doing experiment to setup the job, the CI job may bring impact to normal pr. I should have configured it to other git repo than eagle to avoid such things happen, but any github repo out of apache org is ignored by the pr builder plugin on that Jenkins server.

So, as a whole, let me turn the job's configuration to make it succeed every time and you please reopen your pr to refresh the status, so that your process won't be blocked. Make sense?
It's done, please try reopen again and see if this pr can get refreshed.

Comments:
1. I want to apply the patch in my local machine. It fails, you will have the same issue when you apply the patch to master. You probably need collapse all your commits into one commits, then it will not have any conflict
2. the script only query jmx with "qry=Hadoop:_", then we will miss other metric like java.lang:_ etc. Can the script download everything, but use the configuration in eagle-collector.conf to specify which parts to preserve.

more comments:
1) site attribute should be part of metric dimension
2) I would suggest we change attribute name "type" to "component"
another comments: can we make this tool into eagle-external?
Yes, I agree with your comments. Thanks. I will update the scripts.
One comment: why do we need named audit listener? I see HBaseStorageAudit.isAuditingRequired checks if the passed service name matches "AlertDefinitionService" or "AlertDataSourceService".

For the particular implementation in HBaseStorageAudit, we would be auditing the HBase operations only for the services - AlertDefinitionService and AlertDataSourceService provided the auditing option is  also enabled . Having named registering of implementation will help us to include/remove another implementation if required.
understood, please go ahead to merge

@yonzhang , if we're going to run the script and merge, PRs need an approval comment on this page. The approval comment should contain a single line with a string, either ":+1:" (consists of ':','+','1', and ':'), or "LGTM", we can regard these 2 string as approval marks.

Please take notice, the marks should be the only message in a single line, and other message of the same comment could be above or below the marks, just like the following:

:+1: 

or

LGTM

Then, when you execute the merge script, it will verify and know that this PR is reviewed and approved to be merged.
